required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Does Daily Supplementation of Lactobacillus Acidophilus MPH734, for One Week, Affect Acute (Immediate), Subacute (7 Days), and Post-treatment Discontinuation Lactose Metabolism, Gastrointestinal Symptoms, and Clinical Markers of Inflammation and Safety Compared to a Placebo
clinical_study.official_title: Does Daily Supplementation of Lactobacillus Acidophilus MPH734 (Lacto-FreedomTM, or LF), for One Week, Affects Acute (Immediate), Subacute (7 Days), and Post-treatment Discontinuation (30-, 60-, and 90- Day) Lactose Metabolism, Gastrointestinal Symptoms, and Clinical Markers of Inflammation and Safety Compared to a Placebo?

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if twice or three times daily supplementation of Lactobacillus acidophilus MPH734 (Lacto-FreedomTM, or LF), for one week, affects acute (immediate), subacute (7 days), and post-treatment discontinuation (30-, 60-, and 90- day) lactose metabolism, gastrointestinal symptoms, and clinical markers of inflammation and safety compared to a placebo.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 3 treatments: low dose probiotic, high dose probiotic, placebo

primary_outcome.measure: Lactobacillus Acidophilus MPH734's Effect on lactose digestion in individuals who identify as lactose sensitive, intolerant, or avoid dairy.
primary_outcome.description: Primary outcome of this study is to determine if twice or three times daily supplementation of Lactobacillus acidophilus MPH734 (Lacto-FreedomTM, or LF), for one week, affects acute (immediate), subacute (7 days), and post-treatment discontinuation (30-, 60-, and 90- day) lactose metabolism, gastrointestinal symptoms, and clinical markers of inflammation and safety compared to a placebo.

arm_group.description: Taken once prior to the first testing session, 3x a day every day for the 7 days of supplementation, and taken one last time during second testing session.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low dose 10 billion CFU per day
arm_group.description: Taken once prior to the first testing session, 3x a day every day for the 7 days of supplementation, and taken one last time during second testing session.

arm_group.arm_group_label: High dose 15 billion CFU per day
arm_group.description: Taken once prior to the first testing session, 3x a day every day for the 7 days of supplementation, and taken one last time during second testing session.

intervention.description: After supplementing with oral probiotics, it has been suggested that select probiotics capable of expressing Beta-glucosidase enzyme activity may likewise be effective treatment for lactose intolerance.
intervention.arm_group_label: High dose 15 billion CFU per day
Low dose 10 billion CFU per day

intervention.description: placebo made to match dietary supplement being tested.
